sense.name: a specific method or device employed to attain a goal
sense.examples: Bob will resort to any tactic to get that promotion in his department. We need to try a different tactic to move negotiations forward. Having a time limit to prevent something terrible from happening is an effective plot tactic to build suspense within the dramatic arc of a story.

sense.name: specific maneuver of troops in a military battle
sense.commentary: TACTIC[+activity][+maneuver][+specific][+battle][+military] Note: implies physical movement of troops and equipment Note: often occurs in the plural
sense.examples: The general's brilliant tactics won the battle for him, even though his troops were outnumbered. It's a classic naval tactic taught at all military academies. The coach's tactics have not helped him score in the first quarter of the game. (metaphoric extension)
